title: Steel Cut Oats Pongal 🙂 | Kids | Breakfast | Healthy Diet
content:
Breakfast recipe: Steel Cut Oats Pongal Servings: 2 Duration: 20 mins In any South Indian home Easy and quick breakfast recipe is Upma/ Pongal people who like Upma are very less but most of the people who likes Upma in different variations if it cooked with spices, Veggies which makes your Upma tasty & delicious 😋 Upma/ Pongal is a kind of thick porridge which is smooth & easy to swallow especially for kids. Usually Pongal is prepared with rice, yellow moong Dal, spices and ghee.. on healthy basis I made Pongal with oats instead of rice.. it turned out delicious 😋 Pongal can made in two varieties one is sweet and other savory. I prepared savory which is peppery and nutty 😀 Now a days, most of you like Oats in any way there are many varieties with Oats so today I’m sharing quick Oats Pongal. I hope you like it Let’s start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Steel Cut Oats - 180 gms
  • Split Yellow Moong Dal - 80 gms
  • Fine Black pepper powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Ghee - 2 tb sp ( melted )
  • Hing/ Asafoetida - 1/4 tsp
  • Curry Leaves - 4 to 5
  • Cashew nuts - split - 10-12 pieces
  • Water - 480 ml
Procedure: Prepreparation:
  • Add split yellow moong Dal in a bowl of water
  • Soak 30 mins
  • Keep aside
Process of making Oats Pongal:
  • Heat a skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add ghee
  • Add cumin seeds, curry leaves and cashew nuts
  • Saute 30 secs and add pepper powder, hing & salt
  • Saute more 30 secs
  • Next Add steel cut oats
  • Saute one minute
  • Add soaked split yellow moong Dal
  • Mix well and add water.
  • Stir water and close with a lid
  • Cook 10-12 mins
  • Open lid and check.. oats cooked well
  • Serve hot with peanut chutney or coconut chutney...
  • Kids will enjoy.. Happy cooking and enjoy your day
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • You can use melted butter instead of ghee
  • If you're using rolled oats reduce water consistency.
  • Suppose if you add 150 gms of rolled oats and 50 gms of split yellow moong Dal, add 300-350 ml water..
